title: Authors and Citation
text: Darren Norris. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Norris D (2023). eprdados: Datasets teaching Landscape Ecology. R package version 0.1.0, https://darrennorris.github.io/eprdados/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {eprdados: Datasets for teaching Landscape Ecology},   author = {Darren Norris},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://darrennorris.github.io/eprdados/}, }

title: Datasets for teaching Landscape Ecology
text: Conjuntos de dados para o ensino de Ecologia de Paisagens. Datasets teaching landscape Ecology.

title: Datasets for teaching Landscape Ecology
text: can install development version eprdados GitHub : Você pode instalar o pacote eprdados através comando:

title: Datasets for teaching Landscape Ecology
text: basic example shows make map data package: Package developed built using following guides: Fan Wang: https://fanwangecon.github.io/PkgTestR/articles/ffv_pkgdown_github.html Emil Hvitfeldt: https://emilhvitfeldt.com/post/2018-09-02-usethis-workflow--package-development/
code: #> |---------|---------|---------|---------|=========================================                                           #> |---------|---------|---------|---------|=========================================                                          |---------|---------|---------|---------|=========================================                                          |---------|---------|---------|---------|=========================================                                          |---------|---------|---------|---------|========================================= library(eprdados) library(tmap) mapbiomas_2020 <- rast(utm_cover_AP_rio_2020)  # Reclassificação -  # Criar uma nova camada de floresta (novo objeto de raster copiando mapbiomas_2020,  # assim para ter os mesmos coordenados, resolução e extensão) floresta_2020 <- mapbiomas_2020 # Todos os pixels com valor de 0 values(floresta_2020) <- 0 # Atualizar com valor de 1 quando pixels originais são de floresta (classe 3 e 4) floresta_2020[mapbiomas_2020==3 | mapbiomas_2020==4] <- 1  # Passo necessario para agilizar o processamento floresta_2020_modal <- aggregate(floresta_2020,                                   fact=10,                                   fun="modal") # pontos cada 5 km rio_pontos_31976 <- rio_pontos |>    st_transform(31976)  # linha central de rios rio_linhacentral_31976 <- rio_linhacentral |>    st_transform(31976)  # Mapa tm_shape(floresta_2020_modal) +   tm_raster(style = "cat",              palette = c("0" = "#E974ED", "1" ="#129912"), legend.show = FALSE) +    tm_add_legend(type = "fill", labels = c("não-floresta", "floresta"),     col = c("#E974ED", "#129912"), title = "Classe") +  tm_shape(rio_linhacentral_31976) +    tm_lines(col="blue") +  tm_shape(rio_pontos_31976) +    tm_dots(size = 0.2, col = "yellow") +  tm_layout(legend.bg.color="white")

what: Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
title: Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
text: Values simulated species around rural property locations Amapá, Brazil. Includes landscape metrics MapBiomas forest cover class. Metrics calculated buffers radius :  0.125, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8 16 km. reduce influence satellite image quality, metric values median values three years:  study year, year year .  Values one metric cpland calculated using package landscapemetrics.  cpland percentage core area forest class relation total landscape area. Abundances presence absence 3 species simulated using package virtualspecies.

title: Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
text: `carnivoros` dataframe, : aid Property identifier. long Longitude. Decimal degrees (EPSG:4326). lat Latitude. Decimal degrees (EPSG:4326). lat Habitat_WWF. Terrestrial ecoregion. https://doi.org/10.1641/0006-3568(2001)051[0933:TEOTWA]2.0.CO;2 metric Metric identifier landscapemetrics. buff_dist_km Buffer distance. Radius km. value_median Median value landscape metric. sp_name Identifier simulated species. sp_ab Species abundances. sp_pa Species presence absence.

title: Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
text: subset three carnivore species abundances landscape metrics around properties.

title: Carnivore species and landscape metrics. — carnivoros
code: # check data. 3 species x 106 properties = 318 table(carnivoros$buff_dist_km) #>  #> 0.125  0.25   0.5     1     2     4     8    16  #>   318   318   318   318   318   318   318   318  # check data. 106 properties x 8 buffer distances = 848 table(carnivoros$sp_name) #>  #> sppB sppC sppD  #>  848  848  848

Values one metric cpland calculated using package landscapemetrics.  cpland percentage core area forest class relation total landscape area.

title: Species and landscape metrics. — interview_species_metrics
text: Values simulated species around rural property locations Amapá, Brazil. Includes landscape metrics MapBiomas forest cover class. Metrics calculated buffers radius :  0.125, 0.25, 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8 16 km. reduce influence satellite image quality, metric values median values three years:  study year, year year .  Values one metric cpland calculated using package landscapemetrics.  cpland percentage core area class relation total landscape area. Abundances presence absence 11 species simulated using package virtualspecies.

title: Species and landscape metrics. — interview_species_metrics
text: `interview_species_metrics` dataframe, : aid Property identifier. long Longitude. Decimal degrees (EPSG:4326). lat Latitude. Decimal degrees (EPSG:4326). lat Habitat_WWF. Terrestrial ecoregion. https://doi.org/10.1641/0006-3568(2001)051[0933:TEOTWA]2.0.CO;2 metric Metric identifier landscapemetrics. buff_dist_km Buffer distance. Radius km. value_median Median value landscape metric. sp_name Identifier simulated species. sp_ab Species abundances. sp_pa Species presence absence.

title: Centerline of river channels. — rio_linhacentral
text: Centerline rivers upstream Cachoeira Caldeirão Dam. total 260 km rivers, obtained GPS tracklogs recorded boat surveys along rivers. Rivers divided 52 sections approximately 5 km intervals. Used develop -control-impact analysis dam impacts species including Giant Otters (https://doi.org/10.7717/peerj.14287) Yellow-spotted River Turtles ( https://doi.org/10.1002/aqc.3775). location Amapá, Brazil. coord. ref WGS 84 (EPSG:4326).

title: Centerline of river channels. — rio_linhacentral
text: `rio_linhacentral` sf MULTILINESTRING geometry, 52 river sections 6 variables, including: subz_id Unique identifier. secl_r Length river section meters. impact Dam impact. 1 = yes, 0 = .

title: Centerline of river channels. — rio_linhacentral
text: <https://fmichalski.wixsite.com/lecov>

title: Centerline of river channels. — rio_linhacentral
text: Centerline Araguari Falsino rivers.

title: Centerline of river channels. — rio_linhacentral
code: # plot to see the rivers plot(rio_linhacentral["rio"])   # total length of rivers (262276.4 [m]) sum(st_length(rio_linhacentral)) #> 262276.4 [m]

title: Sample points along rivers. — rio_pontos
text: sample points along centerline rivers upstream Cachoeira Caldeirão Dam. total 52 points regularly spaced approximately 5 km intervals. Used develop -control-impact analysis dam impacts species including Giant Otters (https://doi.org/10.7717/peerj.14287) Yellow-spotted River Turtles ( https://doi.org/10.1002/aqc.3775). location Amapá, Brazil. coord. ref WGS 84 (EPSG:4326).

title: Sample points along rivers. — rio_pontos
text: `rio_pontos` sf POINT geometry 52 points 8 fields, including: subz_id Unique identifier. long Longitude. Decimal degrees. lat Latitude. Decimal degrees. impact Dam impact. 1 = yes, 0 = .

text: <https://fmichalski.wixsite.com/lecov>

text: Sample points along Araguari Falsino rivers.

title: Sample points along rivers. — rio_pontos
code: # plot to see the points plot(rio_pontos["rio"])
